commentBody: Pro football is exciting for about eight seconds for every play. Televised games often run 2 1/2 hours to present the 60 minutes of actual playing time. Commercials, talking heads who inform us of what we've just seen, side-line "interviews" which reveal "what the game is all about" run interminably. And what exactly is a "two minute warning?" I get notices, alarms, beeps, chirps, every day, each of which takes less than a second. But football coaches who watch the clock carefully need a "warning" when each half is going to end? Bill Belichick needs a "warning"? About what? Oh: commercials. We get a two minute warning to tell us to grab a beer, preferably of the advertised suds.
